If you're looking for a term to describe a personal collection of knowledge and insights that you have accumulated over time, you might consider using the term "personal knowledge base."

A personal knowledge base is a collection of information and insights that an individual has acquired through experience, study, and reflection. This might include ideas, concepts, strategies, and other forms of knowledge that are relevant to a person's personal or professional life. Like a library or collection, a personal knowledge base is organized and maintained by the individual, with the intention of preserving and expanding their understanding of the world.

The term "personal knowledge base" is not commonly used in everyday conversation, but it is a well-established term in the field of knowledge management and information science. It is a useful term to describe the type of personal storage location that you are referring to, as it emphasizes the importance of knowledge and insights in our personal and professional lives.

To convey this concept to others in English, you might explain that a personal knowledge base is a collection of information and insights that you have accumulated over time, through your experiences, reading, and reflection. You might also give examples of the types of knowledge that you have stored in your personal knowledge base, and explain how it has helped you to solve problems, make decisions, and achieve your goals.
